## ASTR 201: Astronomy for Science Majors

ASTR 201 is a **quantitative** astronomy course: we use math and physics to infer what the universe is doing from limited observations.

## How to succeed in this course

- Show your reasoning (steps, units, assumptions).
- Use homework + grade memos to prepare for exams.
- Ask for help early (see “Communication & Getting Help” in the syllabus).

::: {.callout-note}
## Where to get help

- Instructor: during class + office hours
- Canvas discussion: questions others may share
- Classmates: collaborate on ideas (submit your own work)
- SDSU Astronomy Help Room: free tutoring (schedule on Canvas)
:::
